sen.j: 藤原 遵子（ふじわら の じゅんし（のぶこ）、天徳 (日本)元年（957年） - 寛仁元年6月1日_(旧暦)（1017年6月27日））は平安時代中期、関白藤原頼忠の長女。
sen.e: FUJIWARA no Junshi (or Nobuko) (957 - June 27, 1017) was the first daughter of FUJIWARA no Yoritada, the Chancellor (chief advisor to the Emperor) in the mid-Heian period.

sen.j: 遵子が入内した当時、後宮には既に中宮藤原こう子がいた。
sen.e: When Junshi entered into the imperial court, FUJIWARA no Koshi was serving as chugu at the inner palace.

sen.e: When Koshi died in 979, Junshi and FUJIWARA no Senshi, another nyogo of Emperor Enyu, competed for the position of chugu.

sen.j: その結果、第一皇子（一条天皇）を産んだ詮子ではなく関白頼忠の娘遵子が中宮となった。
sen.e: Junshi, who was a daughter of FUJIWARA no Yoritada, the Chancellor (chief advisor to the Emperor), eventually won the battle, defeating Senshi, who had already given birth to the first prince of Emperor Enyu (who later became Emperor Ichijo) and became chugu.

sen.j: 遵子立后の日、弟の公任は得意になって詮子方に「こちらの女御（詮子）はいつ立后なさるのかな」と言い放った。
sen.e: According to "Okagami" (the Great Mirror), on the day of Junshi becoming chugu, Kinto, her younger brother, insulted Senshi's attendants by saying, "When is Senshi going to be chugu?".

sen.j: 遵子はその後もついに皇子を産むことはなく、一条天皇の即位で詮子が皇太后になった際、公任は逆に詮子の女房から「姉君の素腹の后はどちらにおいでで？」と皮肉られたという。
sen.e: Junshi, however, had never given birth to a prince of Emperor Enyu, and when Emperor Ichijo rose to the throne and Senshi became Empress Dowager, one of Senshi's lady attendant ironically asked Kinto, "Where is your sister, an empress with no child?"

sen.e: After Emperor Enyu abdicated the throne, Junshi moved her residence to Shijo-dai, her country house, and therefore, was called "Shijo no miya".
